Jacquelyn Niklas & Kevin Thomson

July 28th, 2018

We are tying the damn knot!!

Our Story

Our Story began in early 2016 when we met at a dinner party held by our mutual friends, Stephanie and Joey Vernon. Kevin was living in Salt Lake City at the time and was in Denver to visit and ski with the Vernon's. Jacque and Kevin talked most of the night about their common interests, skiing and running, and eventually went their separate ways. Later that year, while Kevin was visiting again, Jacque was invited to to join everyone for a weekend of spring skiing in Summit County. What was supposed to be a fun day on the slopes turned into a little too much fun at the bar, which was then followed up the next day with a hangover of epic proportions. In an effort to salvage what was left of the ski weekend, Jacque dragged Kevin onto the slopes and they enjoyed an amazing bluebird day at Keystone, curing their hangover with some fresh mountain air.

Once again, they went their separate ways. However, this time with the help of the internet Gods, they were able to reconnect. A few photo likes led to a few messages which led to hours of phone time and eventually a trip to Salt Lake City. Without much convincing, Kevin eventually moved to Denver and it didn't take long to decide that they were going to spend the rest of their lives together.

The Details

Attire & Weather

Wedding attire will be Dressy Casual

It gets a little chilly at 9,101' when the sun goes down so please be prepared with a light coat, shawl, etc.

We won't be going treks in this mountain town but it doesn't feature any pavement or level sidewalks. Stilletos are not advised.

Schedule of Events

Starting at 4pm at Bread Bar

Ceremony followed by dinner and dancing.

Due to the nature of our venue and celebration we respectfully ask that you leave the kids at home.

Registry

Your attendence will be a gift unto itself, however, we would be very grateful for cash donations if you would also like to contribute to our honeymoon.

We will be spending our honeymoon in Spain and Portugal in late August.

We've have also created a small registry if you prefer.

Please Contact Us

To better organize transportation for everyone, please contact us and let us know the location of your accommodations once you have made reservations. Thank you so much for your help!

Contact Us

The Location

Bread Bar

Bread Bar is a fine mountainside drinking establishment at the foot of the Rocky Mountain range.

Housed in a 1800s-era bakery, Bread Bar honors its rich history and the Silver Plume community as a whole. Come on by, we’d love to make you a drink.

Bread Bar
Silver Plume

Accomodations

Due to the available transportation options it would be best to stay in Georgetown, just 2 miles from the wedding venue and central to all the hiking, dining and activities in Clear Creek County, Colorado. However, as accommodations in Georgetown are limited we will also be providing transportation to Silverthorne.

Airbnb | VRBO | Red Lion | Hotel Chateau Chamonix | Hampton Inn

Georgetown, Colorado
Silverthorne, Colorado

Transportation

Shuttle service will be provided from two, walkable pick-up/drop-off locations on either side of Georgetown. There will also be limited service from the Hampton Inn in Silverthorne. There is taxi and Uber/Lyft available to get you to and from this pick-up/drop-off location if you choose to stay in or near Silverthorne.

We want everyone to share an amazing and fun evening with us and getting everyone home safely is our number one priority so we hope you understand the less than flexible options.

Things To Do

Guanella Pass

Explore Guanella Pass, a beautiful scenic by-way with many options for hiking and site seeing along the way.

Colorado.com Guanella Pass

Mount Bierstadt

Hike a 14er! Mt. Bierstadt (14,065 ft) is just 9 miles from the town of Georgetown along the beautiful Guanella Pass. Often considered to be one of the "easier" 14ers, this 7 mile hike is a great option for those coming from sea-level who still want to take on one of Colorado's highest peaks! Don't be fooled by the moderate milage of this hike though, you'll also have a climb of 2,391 feet but the view at the top is worth every step!

14ers.com Mt. Bierstadt

Hiking

There are endless options in the nearby area. See the link below to find one that suits you best.

alltrails.com

Georgetown Loop Railroad

Take a ride on the Georgetown Loop Railroad, established in 1884 during the Pikes Peak Gold Rush, this rail loop runs between the Georgetown-Silver Plume National Historic Districts.

georgetownlooprr.com
